verses.verse: He will suck the poison of cobras; The viper’s tongue will slay him.
He will not see (Ps. 36:8; Jer. 17:8) the streams, The rivers flowing with honey and cream.
He will restore that for which he labored, And will not swallow it down; From the proceeds of business He will get no enjoyment.
For he has oppressed and forsaken the poor, He has violently seized a house which he did not build.
“Because (Eccl. 5:13-15) he knows no quietness in his heart, He will not save anything he desires.
Nothing is left for him to eat; Therefore his well-being will not last.
In his self-sufficiency he will be in distress; Every hand of misery will come against him.
When he is about to fill his stomach, God will cast on him the fury of His wrath, And will rain it on him while he is eating.
(Is. 24:18; Amos 5:19) He will flee from the iron weapon; A bronze bow will pierce him through.
It is drawn, and comes out of the body; Yes, (Job 16:13) the glittering point comes out of his gall. (Job 18:11, 14) Terrors come upon him;
Total darkness is reserved for his treasures. (Ps. 21:9) An unfanned fire will consume him; It shall go ill with him who is left in his tent.
The heavens will reveal his iniquity, And the earth will rise up against him.
The increase of his house will depart, And his goods will flow away in the day of His (Job 20:15; 21:30) wrath.
(Job 27:13; 31:2, 3) This is the portion from God for a wicked man, The heritage appointed to him by God.”
(Job’s Discourse on the Wicked) Then Job answered and said:
“Listen carefully to my speech, And let this be your consolation.
Bear with me that I may speak, And after I have spoken, keep (Job 16:10) mocking.
“As for me, is my complaint against man? And if it were, why should I not be impatient?
Look at me and be astonished; (Judg. 18:19; Job 13:5; 29:9; 40:4) Put your hand over your mouth.
Even when I remember I am terrified, And trembling takes hold of my flesh.
(Job 12:6; Ps. 17:10, 14; 73:3, 12; (Jer. 12:1); Hab. 1:13, 16) Why do the wicked live and become old, Yes, become mighty in power?
Their descendants are established with them in their sight, And their offspring before their eyes.
Their houses are safe from fear, (Ps. 73:5) Neither is the rod of God upon them.
Their bull breeds without failure; Their cow calves (Ex. 23:26) without miscarriage.
They send forth their little ones like a flock, And their children dance.
They sing to the tambourine and harp, And rejoice to the sound of the flute.
They (Job 21:23; 36:11) spend their days in wealth, And in a moment go down to the grave.
(Job 22:17) Yet they say to God, ‘Depart from us, For we do not desire the knowledge of Your ways.
(Ex. 5:2; Job 22:17; 34:9) Who is the Almighty, that we should serve Him? And (Job 35:3; Mal. 3:14) what profit do we have if we pray to Him?’
Indeed their prosperity is not in their hand; (Job 22:18; Ps. 1:1; Prov. 1:10) The counsel of the wicked is far from me.
“How often is the lamp of the wicked put out? How often does their destruction come upon them, The sorrows God ((Job 31:2, 3; Luke 12:46)) distributes in His anger?
(Ps. 1:4; 35:5; Is. 17:13; Hos. 13:3) They are like straw before the wind, And like chaff that a storm carries away.
They say, ‘God lays up one’s iniquity ((Ex. 20:5); Jer. 31:29; Ezek. 18:2) for his children’; Let Him recompense him, that he may know it.
Let his eyes see his destruction, And (Ps. 75:8; Is. 51:17; Jer. 25:15; Rev. 14:10; 19:15) let him drink of the wrath of the Almighty.
